parameters:
Kotaro: "I was delighted yesterday, Kotaro. You went out of
your way to hold a celebration for me."

Kotaro: "It's nothing. We must reward those who have
contributed, or no one will follow us. I simply did what our
father used to say back in the day."

Kotaro: "Since the previous head of the family passed away,
and Big Brother Daitaro as well... It's already been 5 years
since you took over as the head of the Fuma clan... Time
flies so quickly."

Kotaro: "Brother, do you remember the legend of this Oni
Shrine?"

Kotaro: "Yes... In the Heian period, a man-eating female
demon appeared in the Kanto region--that demon was defeated
by a demon-slaying shrine maiden, and her remaining flesh
was enshrined here--if I recall correctly, that's the
legend."

Kotaro: "After those demon-slaying shrine maidens left the
shrine, our ancestors settled in these mountains, cleared
the land, and built this village of Fuma."

Kotaro: "Ah, now I remember. The origin of the name 'Fuma'
for this village--it originally came from 'Fuma' (), which
means sealing demons, as I heard from the head of the family
when I was a child."

Kotaro: "About 100 years ago, during a festival, a drunken
man from Fuma ate this demon's flesh... and to everyone's
surprise, he grew horns and fangs and turned into a
ferocious demon-- you know this story, don't you?"

Kotaro: "To defeat the demonized man, 30 people were
sacrificed. It was such an old tale... But honestly, the
story of a human eating demon flesh and turning into a demon
is hard to believe. If it were true, eating beef would turn
us into cows. Haha--"

Kotaro: "Have you ever seen this infamous demon flesh in
person?"

Kotaro: "...? No. It's always been under strict lock and
key. I've never seen inside the box."

Kotaro: "This is the flesh inside. It has an ominous color,
doesn't it?"

Kotaro: "Hmm... So this is the legendary demon flesh. It's
different from normal meat, but is it real?"

Kotaro: "Eating demon flesh turns one into a demon--I've
long thought that was just a tall tale... but just between
us, I recently found out it was actually true and it sent
shivers down my spine."
Kotaro: "What...? Did you feed this flesh to someone?"

Kotaro: "Not to a person, no. When brother was away, I fed a
small piece about the size of a fingernail to a field mouse
as a test. And then... what do you think happened?"

Kotaro: "The field mouse grew horns on its head. It devoured
a nearby chicken in no time at all. Like a ravenous bear...
and we're talking about a small field mouse here?"

Kotaro: "Have I ever lied to you before, brother? In a
panic, I immediately chopped up the demonized mouse, but it
wouldn't die easily. It turned into a truly terrifying demon
mouse with abnormal ferocity and regenerative powers..."

Kotaro: "This flesh... it's really the genuine demon flesh
as the legend says... If we humans were to eat it... would
we indeed turn into demons?"

Kotaro: "I don't know. I haven't fed it to any person.
However, this demon flesh could become our trump card for
Fuma."
Kotaro: "--!? Are you thinking of eating it, Kotaro--?"

Kotaro: "Hahaha! Of course, I have no desire to eat such
demon flesh. If there ever comes a time to eat it, it would
only be when this village of Fuma truly faces dire straits."

Kotaro: "...Yes, that makes sense. If eating it alone made
us strong, it would negate the value of the skills we Fuma
ninjas have honed through rigorous daily training...
Besides, growing horns would make turning over in bed quite
troublesome."

Kotaro: "We don't know if we'll go to war with the capital
in the future, but I'll make sure to tell everyone in the
village to continue their daily training. Brother, please do
the same. I'm counting on you."

Kotaro: "Understood. Don't overburden yourself too much as
the leader of Fuma, Kotaro--"

Kotaro: "Ah. I will surely lead this village of Fuma in a
good direction."

Kotaro: "Piling up hundreds of corpses, stacking up bodies--
eventually becoming obsessed with creating drugs that induce
illusions."

To ensure that my victims do not suffer pain, to hope they
can die peacefully while lost in hallucinations--

That was the reason I was said to have mastered the art of
illusion in the streets--

...Do not make a sound. Be at ease. I do not cut down women
or children.

What's wrong? You were talking in your sleep as if you were
in pain. Were you having another nightmare...?

...Ah. A dream of the past... of killing many people.
Sneaking into the enemy's residence as a shadow and turning
their futons into a sea of blood without anyone knowing...

If the enemy general dies, there will be no battle. One
death saves many lives. That was believed to be right... to
protect women and children...

But... after I killed an enemy general, I heard that his
only daughter, a princess, plunged a blade into her throat
and threw herself into the moat covered in blood... The
enemy was further incited, and they continued to fight until
their clan was annihilated.

I believed it was an important job to avoid war... but my
thinking was naive... a truly naive fantasy.

Since then, I suddenly became afraid of killing people and
stopped taking assassination jobs... I vowed never to kill
again. I decided to focus solely on intelligence work that
didn't involve seeing blood--

I apologize, Korin. My kimono is drenched with sweat. I need
to change.

...Regardless of the past, you are different now. Seven
years ago, during the collapse of Koshu, you risked your
life to save me, a walking shrine maiden... even though you
were an enemy ninja...

You are a kind person. Very much so... That's why I fell in
love with you and we are together like this--

There there, don't cry at night, Karin. Please soothe Karin
while I go get the change of clothes.

...(Karin is also looking at me and laughing... As the head
of the family, I must be more resolute...)
----[At the same time, at the Fuma mansion]----

--Lord, I apologize for disturbing your rest. A letter has
just arrived from the main castle in Odawara!

What... It is not a good sign for a letter to be sent at
such a late hour. It must be an urgent message.
